page.title: 11Home Farm,Cortachy
page.content: The farmer at{Cortachy Home Farm } employs a dairy man,a cattle man and a tractor man to work the{480 acres}and manage the herd of{320 Friesians. } Milking cows number 120.They are milked twice daily. Each morning approx. {400 gallons}of milk is conveyed to Dundee by a Milk Marketing Board tanker. Bullocks,calfing cows,heifers and young calves complete the herd. Cattle are sold at the markets in Stirling,Forfar or Kirriemuir. Sometimes local farmers come to buy calves at the farm. {250 acres}of crops are grown,a small amount of which is kept for cattle food in the form of silage or hay. The farmer is happy when crops grow well and milk yield is high.
